snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg proposed a spending plan lacking drama, with the most contentious elements of the budget at least seeming familiar.
abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, seeking to stabilize the city's finances after years of budget crunches and economic trouble, proposes a spending plan free of tax increases or layoffs of teachers, police officers or firefighters; proposed $68.7 billion budget is about 2 percent higher than the budget for the current year.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg proposed a spending plan lacking drama, with the most contentious elements of the budget at least seeming familiar.

headline.seo: Mayor Bloomberg’s Budget Avoids Tax Rises or Broad Layoffs
headline.main: As Fiscal Cloud Lifts, Mayor Offers a Budget Free of Tax Increases or Broad Layoffs
headline.print_headline: As Fiscal Cloud Lifts, Mayor Offers a Budget Free of Tax Increases or Broad Layoffs: Placid Proposal Whose Cuts Have a Familiar Veneer
